result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeffrey J Glaser was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: AMENDED 4/12/2016:  COURT WILL CONSIDER EARLY TERMINATION AFTER 1 YEAR ONLY IF APPROVED BY PROBATION AGENT.

miscConds.notes:
Court costs and DNA surcharge are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No contact with the victim S. H. or B. H. listed in the criminal complaint.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Write a letter of apology to S. H. and B. H. if Agent approves.
Inform doctors and/or treatment providers probation requirements.
AMENDED 4/12/2016:  SIGN ANY RELEASES OF INFORMATION AS REQUIRED BY AGENT.

timeConds.notes:
Non-working hours (Huber) with all standard release conditions.
STAYED - to be used at Agent's discretion.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.
Character letter filed

Defendant Jeffrey J Glaser in court with attorney Gerald S Boisits.  Mary Caitlin Brejcha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant enters a plea of no contest to Count 1,  Court finds defendant guilty.
Count 2 is dismissed and read in.
  The Defendant was sentenced to the following:

IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

180 DAYS HUBER, w/Standard Release Conditions (CREDIT - 0 days);

TERM OF PROBATION:  2 YEAR(S);

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
*AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
*Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
*No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
*No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
*Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
*Inform Agent of all prescriptions
*Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
*Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
*No contact with victim S.H. or B. H. listed in complaint.
*DNA sample to be provided and pay costs associated.
*Write a letter of apology to S.H. and B.H. if agent approves. 
*Inform doctors and/or treatment providers probation requirements. 
*Sign any releases of information as required by agent. 
*Court will consider early termination after 1 year only if approved by probation agent.

RESTITUTION:  Zero. 

COURT COSTS:  $268 (to be paid as a condition of probation);

DNA SURCHARGE:  $250 (to be paid as a condition of probation);

CONDITION TIME: 10 days, non-working hours, STAYED; to be used at agent's discretion.  

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Jeffrey J Glaser in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant states he is not eligible for the public defender and requests a court appointed counsel.  Court grants the request.  Defendant to reimburse the county at the rate of $150.00 per month commencing June 15, 2015 and the 15th of each month thereafter.   Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Defendant to report to Room C112 to set up payment.  Hearing scheduled for June 9, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Hearing on May 19, 2015 at 10:00 am.
